titles.title: Access to Critical Non-Emergency Transportation Services Act
Access to Critical Non-Emergency Transportation Services Act

To require the Secretary of Health and Human Services, in coordination with single State agencies, to assist certain dual eligible individuals participating in the RSNAT model with accessing non-emergency medical assistance benefits under the Medicaid program, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.

bill.summary:
Access to Critical Non-Emergency Transportation Services Act
This bill requires the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services to work with state Medicaid programs to assist individuals who are dually eligible for Medicare and Medicaid with accessing non-emergency transportation benefits under Medicaid. The bill applies to dually eligible individuals who are participating in the Repetitive, Scheduled Non-Emergent Ambulance Transport Prior Authorization Model under Medicare.
